questions.question: Who is the first person you talk to about planning a party at home?

choices.answer: My friends, because I'm inviting them to the party
Pizza Hut, because I want to serve pizza at the party
My parents, because the party will be at their house
My teacher, so that I can tell her she's not invited

questions.question: Your friends are helping you plan the party. Who is in charge of the budget?

choices.answer: Jimmy - has a 56% in math class
Sarah - spent $500 on a PS5 and can't buy lunch this week
Eddy - runs a side business selling candy
Marie - tends to be forgetful

questions.question: How often should you check with the other party planners to see how things are going?

choices.answer: Every few days, to see progress and to check who needs help
No check-ins; just see how it goes on the day of the party
Only when they come to you with a question
Every single day at morning, noon, and midnight

questions.question: How should you keep track of things you have to do before the party?

choices.answer: Do things as they come to mind
Create a list of things to do
Ask your mom to keep track of things for you
Ignore your responsibilities and play video games

questions.question: Jonny is great at choosing music and is familiar with how to cook or plan games. What is Jonny called?

choices.answer: Jonny is an L-shaped person
Jonny is an I-shaped person
Jonny is an X-shaped person
Jonny is a T-shaped person

questions.question: Let's say you have to plan a party with only 3 days notice. What is NOT an essential part of the party?

choices.answer: The guests
The refreshments
The music, games, or entertainment
The decorations
